docs.title: 1. Accessories
docs.text:
Place the gate in the provided stand, or hang it onto a wall using the wall hanger.

Tip: the gate works best when placed against a wall with 4-6cm gap.

docs.title: Optionally, attach the engines
docs.text:
• The engines will work only with a correct pin orientation.
  • The engines will turn on only during the gate powerup. When attached to already powered gate, the engines won't turn on.
  • All the engines need to be attached to turn on

docs.title: 2. Power up the gate
docs.text: Connect a 5V@3A power supply to the USB-C port at the bottom of the Stargate.

docs.title: 3. Connect to the Stargate web interface
docs.text: Open up the interface on a phone or a computer and connect the gate via Bluetooth. The interface can be used to control the gate, and it provides a way for the gate to play sound effects.

docs.title: 4. Power up the DHD
docs.text: Power up the DHD by pressing the button on the bottom side. To turn it off later, double tap the button.

docs.title: 5. Dial the gate!
docs.text: Just use random 7 symbols, for now :) Specific addresses coming in the future firmware together with a bunch of extra features.
